de.mrapp.android.preference

Class SwitchPreference

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.preference.Preference
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractTwoStatePreference
        • de.mrapp.android.preference.SwitchPreference
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<android.preference.Preference>

    public class SwitchPreference
extends AbstractTwoStatePreference
    A preference, which provides a two-state toggleable option using a SwitchCompat widget.
    Since:
    1.4.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwitchPreference

        public SwitchPreference(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new preference, which provides a two-state toggleable option using a SwitchCompat widget.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • SwitchPreference

        public SwitchPreference(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context,
                        @Nullable
                        android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new preference, which provides a two-state toggleable option using a SwitchCompat widget.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available

      • SwitchPreference

        public SwitchPreference(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context,
                        @Nullable
                        android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                        @AttrRes
                        int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new preference, which provides a two-state toggleable option using a SwitchCompat widget.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • SwitchPreference

        public SwitchPreference(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context,
                        @Nullable
                        android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                        @AttrRes
                        int defaultStyle,
                        @StyleRes
                        int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new preference, which provides a two-state toggleable option using a SwitchCompat widget.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

    • Method Detail

      • getSwitchTextOn

        public final java.lang.CharSequence getSwitchTextOn()
        Returns the text, which is displayed on the preference's switch, when it is checked.
        Returns:
        The text, which is displayed on the preference's switch, when it is checked, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no dedicated text is displayed when the preference's switch is checked

      • setSwitchTextOn

        public final void setSwitchTextOn(@Nullable
                                  java.lang.CharSequence switchTextOn)
        Sets the text, which should be displayed on the preference's switch, when it is checked. The text should be very short - one word if possible.
        Parameters:
        switchTextOn - The text, which should be set, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no dedicated text should be displayed when the preference's switch is checked

      • setSwitchTextOn

        public final void setSwitchTextOn(@StringRes
                                  int resourceId)
        Sets the text, which should be displayed on the preference's switch, when it is checked. The text should be very short - one word if possible.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the text, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource

      • getSwitchTextOff

        public final java.lang.CharSequence getSwitchTextOff()
        Returns the text, which is displayed on the preference's switch, when it is not checked.
        Returns:
        The text, which is displayed on the preference's switch, when it is not checked, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no dedicated text is displayed when the preference's switch is not checked

      • setSwitchTextOff

        public final void setSwitchTextOff(@Nullable
                                   java.lang.CharSequence switchTextOff)
        Sets the text, which should be displayed on the preference's switch, when it is not checked. The text should be very short - one word if possible.
        Parameters:
        switchTextOff - The text, which should be set, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no dedicated text should be displayed when the preference's switch is not checked

      • setSwitchTextOff

        public final void setSwitchTextOff(@StringRes
                                   int resourceId)
        Sets the text, which should be displayed on the preference's switch, when it is not checked. The text should be very short - one word if possible.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the text, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource
